abstract: A new study from Johns Hopkins University says headaches have been a leading cause of attrition in units deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan.
snippet: A new study from Johns Hopkins University says headaches have been a leading cause of attrition in units deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: Ask anyone about the signature wounds of the current wars and the list is likely to include lost limbs, traumatic brain injury, post-traumatic stress, back strains and knee pains. But a new study from Johns Hopkins University says the plain old headache has been a leading cause of attrition in units deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan.

headline.main: A War Injury With a Big Impact: The Plain Old Headache
